danish_publication: Frederik Glarmester, der var røgter på Vilhelmsborg, han fortalte, at hans moder var en trold, og hun skulde til Troms kirke hver Voldborg aften. Da han var bleven en stor knægt, så tykte han, han vilde også gjærne prøve denher riden. Han red på et limeskaft, og hans moder red på en rage. Men han havde jo ikke rigtig fået fat på, hvad hun sagde, og så sagde han: "Op og ned og op og ned", og så blev han ved til det øverste af skorstenen og så ned igjen, og sådan blev han ved, til det blev dag, og sled alle klæderne af sig, både tröje og bukser, så der var snart ikke klædetråd på ham, da han endelig var fri og kunde gå hans vej.
english_publication: Frederik Glarmester was a cowhand at Vilhelmsborg, he said that his mother was a troll (witch), she had to go to Troms church every Voldborg eve (Midsummer’s eve). When he had become a big boy he decided that he also wanted to try that ride. He rode on a broomstick and his mother rode on a rake. But he hadn’t really caught what she had said and then he said: “Up and down and up and down” and then he continued to the top of the chimney and then down again, and he continued like that until it daybreak, and the ride wore all his clothes off of him, his shirt and his pants, so there wasn’t a stitch of clothes left on him when he finally got free and could go his way.
